domain

Class ByteSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.ByteSequence

  • public class ByteSequence
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a sequence of bytes. Constructor parameters hash table size and hash factor determine how the hashCode() will be calculated, using a rolling hash formula like the one in this Wikipedia article https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolling_hash#Polynomial_rolling_hash (where a = hashFactor, and n = hashTableSize).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteSequence()
      Returns an instance of ByteSequence with length zero and default values for hash table size and hash factor.
      ByteSequence(byte[] bytes)
      Returns an instance of ByteSequence corresponding to the given byte array, meaning that the new ByteSequence will be as long as the given array, and will consist of the same byte values which are found in the given array, in the same order.
      ByteSequence(int hashTableSize, int hashFactor)
      Returns an instance of ByteSequence whose hashCode() method will use the given hash table size and hash factor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void append(byte b)
      Appends the given byte value to the end of this ByteSequence.
      int copyTo(byte[] a, int fromIndex)
      Copies the byte values of this ByteSequence into the given array, starting from the given index, meaning that the first byte of this sequence will be copied into a[fromIndex].
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      byte getFirst()
      Returns the first byte of this ByteSequence.
      byte getLast()
      Returns the last byte of this ByteSequence.
      int hashCode() 
      ByteSequence makeClone()
      Returns a clone of this ByteSequence, which will use a new array internally, and thus will be completely independent from this ByteSequence.
      void reset()
      Resets this ByteSequence (sets its length to zero).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ByteSequence

        public ByteSequence()
        Returns an instance of ByteSequence with length zero and default values for hash table size and hash factor.

      • ByteSequence

        public ByteSequence(int hashTableSize,
                    int hashFactor)
        Returns an instance of ByteSequence whose hashCode() method will use the given hash table size and hash factor. The new ByteSequence will have length zero.
        Parameters:
        hashTableSize - Size of the hash table that will be used to calculate the hash code.
        hashFactor - Hash factor that will be used to calculate the hash code.

      • ByteSequence

        public ByteSequence(byte[] bytes)
        Returns an instance of ByteSequence corresponding to the given byte array, meaning that the new ByteSequence will be as long as the given array, and will consist of the same byte values which are found in the given array, in the same order. The given array isn't copied, instead it is used directly, so be careful. The new ByteSequence will use default values for hash table size and hash factor.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array on which the new ByteSequence will be based on.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public void append(byte b)
        Appends the given byte value to the end of this ByteSequence.
        Parameters:
        b - Byte value to be appended.

      • makeClone

        public ByteSequence makeClone()
        Returns a clone of this ByteSequence, which will use a new array internally, and thus will be completely independent from this ByteSequence. The new ByteSequence will have the same length, and will contain the same byte values in the same order.
        Returns:
        A clone of this ByteSequence.

      • copyTo

        public int copyTo(byte[] a,
                  int fromIndex)
        Copies the byte values of this ByteSequence into the given array, starting from the given index, meaning that the first byte of this sequence will be copied into a[fromIndex]. It returns the number of copied elements (which is equal to the length of this ByteSequence).
        Parameters:
        a - Array into which the byte values of this ByteSequence will be copied.
        fromIndex - Index of the given array indicating the starting point where the byte values of this sequence will be copied.
        Returns:
        The number of copied bytes.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this ByteSequence (sets its length to zero).

      • getFirst

        public byte getFirst()
        Returns the first byte of this ByteSequence. It doesn't check for emptiness, so be careful not to call this on an empty sequence.
        Returns:
        The first byte of this ByteSequence (don't call this on empty sequences!).

      • getLast

        public byte getLast()
        Returns the last byte of this ByteSequence. It doesn't check for emptiness, so be careful not to call this on an empty sequence.
        Returns:
        The last byte of this ByteSequence (don't call this on empty sequences!).

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
